roles.name: Budget Analyst
roles.description: Develops and monitors government or corporate budgets, ensuring alignment with financial policies and strategic goals.

meta.typicalBackground: Finance or accounting degree, strong quantitative analysis, knowledge of public sector frameworks

sampleUseCase.scenario: A budget analyst reconciles mid-year spending data, identifies a potential shortfall in capital projects, and recommends transferring funds from underspent lines to maintain timely project completion.

roles.name: Debt Manager
roles.description: Oversees debt issuance and repayment strategies, managing interest rates and maturities to optimize financial obligations.

meta.typicalBackground: Economics, finance, or public administration, knowledge of bond markets and macroeconomics

sampleUseCase.scenario: A debt manager sees favorable market conditions for a 10-year bond issuance to refinance an older, higher-interest note. The move saves millions in annual interest for the treasury.

roles.name: Cash Flow Specialist
roles.description: Manages day-to-day liquidity, ensuring sufficient cash to cover payroll, invoices, and other short-term obligations.

meta.typicalBackground: Accounting or corporate finance background, strong forecasting and liquidity management skills

sampleUseCase.scenario: Noticing a temporary dip in incoming tax receipts, the specialist arranges a short-term line of credit to cover a large payroll outflow, avoiding overdraft penalties.

roles.name: Investment Officer
roles.description: Allocates surplus or reserve funds into securities and other assets, balancing risk and return per treasury policy.

meta.typicalBackground: Finance degree, portfolio management experience, knowledge of interest rates and risk metrics
challenges: Market swings, currency fluctuations, ensuring liquidity for short-term needs

sampleUseCase.scenario: An investment officer invests a portion of treasury reserves in diversified municipal bonds and high-grade corporate notes, ensuring stable yields while preserving liquidity for future obligations.

roles.name: Compliance Officer
roles.description: Ensures treasury operations adhere to legal and regulatory requirements, including anti-money laundering and transparent reporting.

meta.typicalBackground: Law or finance compliance training, familiarity with AML/KYC protocols, thorough knowledge of relevant statutes

sampleUseCase.scenario: A compliance officer detects unusual repeated transfers to an offshore account, flags them for deeper AML investigation, and coordinates with legal to rectify potential wrongdoing.
